turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Tariq Abdul-Wahad.
turn.2: Tariq Abdul-Wahad Tariq Abdul-Wahad (born Olivier Michael Saint-Jean ; November 3, 1974) is a French basketball coach and former player.
turn.3: What are some interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Abdul-Wahad is the current head coach of varsity boys' basketball at Lincoln High School of San Jose, California.
turn.5: What were some of his former jobs?
turn.6: As Olivier Saint-Jean, he played college basketball at Michigan and San Jose State.
turn.7: What did he do after college?
turn.8: In 1997, the Sacramento Kings selected Saint-Jean in the first round of the NBA draft as the 11th overall pick, and Saint-Jean converted to Islam and changed his name to Tariq Abdul-Wahad.
turn.9: What other teams did he play for?
turn.10: From 1997 to 2003, Abdul-Wahad played in the NBA for the Kings, Orlando Magic, Denver Nuggets, and Dallas Mavericks.
turn.12: He was the first player to be raised in France and play in the NBA.
